direct_guidance.watch_for: Martyr complex (giving until empty), or materialism without groundedness.
questions: How can I create more comfort and abundance in practical ways?
Am I caring for my own material needs, or only others'?
Am I being wise with resources, or wasteful?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Do one thing that creates comfort—cook a real meal, organize a space, buy quality basics.
direct_guidance.relationships: Show love through practical care—cook, create comfort, tend shared resources.
direct_guidance.work: Create systems that nurture people and productivity. Care creates better results.
direct_guidance.money: Build wealth steadily. Invest in quality. Create abundance that feels comfortable and sustainable.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either depleted from over-giving or wasteful. Recalibrate: care for yourself if empty, steward wisely if careless.
direct_guidance.shadow: Material martyrdom, or wasteful consumption without appreciation or care.
direct_guidance.mantra: I nurture practically. I create comfort. I tend wisely.
direct_guidance.quick: Nurture the material realm practically. Create comfort. Tend resources. Next 24h: Make one practical improvement.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Queen of Pentacles sits with a coin, surrounded by abundance—garden, home, comfort. She built this through practical care.

lenses.relationships: Show love through practical care—cook, create comfort, tend shared resources.
lenses.work: Create systems that nurture people and productivity. Care creates better results.
lenses.money: Build wealth steadily. Invest in quality. Create abundance that feels comfortable and sustainable.

name: King of Pentacles

numerology.meaning: King is mastery of the material realm—wealth built, resources commanded, security established through competence and vision.

theme: material mastery, wealth building, practical leadership

upright.meaning: You command resources with wisdom and competence. Build wealth. Create systems. Lead through practical mastery. In practice: make strategic financial decisions. Build something that lasts.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'master of material realm' card. Build wealth. Lead with competence. Create lasting security.
voice.pulse: King of Pentacles upright is material command—wealth and resources managed with wisdom.
voice.turn: Make one strategic financial decision today that builds long-term security.

reversed.meaning: Either you're greedy and controlling (hoarding wealth, using money as power), or you're financially reckless (poor stewardship). In practice: if controlling, share wealth. If reckless, get disciplined.

voice.lead_in: King of Pentacles reversed asks: are you using wealth to control, or wasting it through poor stewardship?
voice.pulse: This is the 'greed or recklessness' card—either controlling through money or losing it through carelessness.
voice.turn: If controlling: give generously without strings. If reckless: create and follow a budget for one month.

guidance: Master the material realm. Build wealth strategically. Lead with practical wisdom.
call_to_action: Make one strategic financial decision that builds long-term security or wealth.

direct_guidance.do: Build wealth strategically. Lead with practical competence. Steward resources wisely.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't use money to control people, and don't waste resources through poor management.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Greed disguised as 'ambition,' or financial recklessness disguised as 'generosity.'
questions: Am I building wealth to create security, or to control people?
What strategic financial decision would serve my long-term goals?
Am I a wise steward of resources, or am I wasting what I have?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Make one strategic financial move—invest, save aggressively, or start a business.
direct_guidance.relationships: Build shared wealth with your partner. Financial partnership requires transparency and strategy.
direct_guidance.work: Lead with practical competence. Build systems that create lasting value and wealth.
direct_guidance.money: Master wealth-building. Invest strategically. Create multiple income streams. Build empire.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either greedy or reckless. Recalibrate: share if controlling, discipline if wasteful.
direct_guidance.shadow: Using wealth to control, greed disguised as success, or financial recklessness.
direct_guidance.mantra: I build wealth. I lead wisely. I create lasting security.
direct_guidance.quick: Master the material realm. Build wealth strategically. Lead with wisdom. Next 24h: Make one strategic financial move.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: King of Pentacles sits on a throne surrounded by prosperity—bulls, vines, coins. He built this through competence, not luck.

lenses.relationships: Build shared wealth with your partner. Financial partnership requires transparency and strategy.
lenses.work: Lead with practical competence. Build systems that create lasting value and wealth.
lenses.money: Master wealth-building. Invest strategically. Create multiple income streams. Build empire.

name: Ace of Swords

numerology.meaning: One is breakthrough and clarity—the sword cutting through fog to reveal truth in one clean stroke.

upright.meaning: A breakthrough is here—sudden clarity, truth revealed, mental fog lifting. This is the 'aha' moment. In practice: speak the truth you now see clearly. Cut through the confusion.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'lightning clarity' card. The fog just cleared. You see it now.
voice.pulse: Ace of Swords upright is breakthrough truth—mental clarity cutting through confusion in one stroke.
voice.turn: Name one truth you've just seen clearly. Say it out loud to someone today.

reversed.meaning: Either clarity is clouded (confusion, mental fog), or you're using truth as a weapon (cutting with cruelty). In practice: if confused, wait for clarity. If cruel, soften your delivery.

voice.lead_in: Ace of Swords reversed asks: is your mind foggy, or are you using truth to wound?
voice.pulse: This is the 'clouded thinking or cruel honesty' card—either can't see clearly or weaponizing truth.
voice.turn: If foggy: wait 24 hours before deciding. If cruel: speak truth with more kindness.

guidance: Speak the truth you see clearly. Cut through confusion with honest clarity.
call_to_action: Name one truth out loud. Say what you finally see clearly.

direct_guidance.do: Speak truth clearly and directly. Cut through confusion. Use mental clarity decisively.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't cloud truth to spare feelings, and don't use honesty as a weapon to wound.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Brutal honesty without compassion, or avoiding truth because it's uncomfortable.
questions: What truth have I just seen that I can't unsee?
Is this clarity calling me to speak or to act?
What confusion just cleared—and what does that mean I need to do?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Speak one difficult truth clearly and kindly. Cut through one area of confusion.
direct_guidance.relationships: Say what needs to be said. Clear, honest communication cuts through drama.
direct_guidance.work: Name the problem directly. Clarity creates better solutions than politeness.
direct_guidance.money: See your financial reality clearly. Make decisions from truth, not wishful thinking.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either confused or weaponizing truth. Recalibrate: wait for clarity if foggy, add kindness if cruel.
direct_guidance.shadow: Cruelty disguised as honesty, or avoiding truth to keep peace.
direct_guidance.mantra: I see clearly. I speak truth.
direct_guidance.quick: Speak truth clearly and directly. Cut through confusion. Next 24h: Name one difficult truth clearly and kindly.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Ace of Swords rises from clouds—one clean cut reveals what was always true. Now speak it.

lenses.relationships: Say what needs to be said. Clear, honest communication cuts through drama.
lenses.work: Name the problem directly. Clarity creates better solutions than politeness.
lenses.money: See your financial reality clearly. Make decisions from truth, not wishful thinking.

name: Two of Swords

numerology.meaning: Two is stalemate and difficult choice—blindfolded, holding two swords, unable to move until you decide.

upright.meaning: You're at a decision point but avoiding it. Both options seem equally difficult. In practice: remove the blindfold. Look at the truth. Choose, even if both options hurt.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'stop stalling' card. You know what you're avoiding. Choose.
voice.pulse: Two of Swords upright is mental stalemate—stuck because you won't look at the truth and decide.
voice.turn: Write down both options. List pros and cons. Choose one by end of day.

reversed.meaning: Either you're making a decision (finally removing the blindfold), or you're paralyzed by overthinking. In practice: if deciding, good—follow through. If paralyzed, pick imperfectly.

voice.lead_in: Two of Swords reversed asks: are you finally choosing, or are you more stuck than ever?
voice.pulse: This is the 'decision emerging or deeper paralysis' card—either clarity coming or analysis paralysis worsening.
voice.turn: If deciding: commit fully to your choice today. If paralyzed: flip a coin and commit to what it says.

guidance: Stop avoiding the decision. Look at the truth. Choose, even if it hurts.
call_to_action: Make the decision you've been avoiding. Choose one option by end of day.

direct_guidance.do: Face the decision directly. Gather information, then choose—don't stall forever.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't avoid decisions to keep peace, and don't overthink to the point of paralysis.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Decision avoidance disguised as 'waiting for clarity,' or false balance to avoid choosing.
questions: What decision am I avoiding by pretending both options are equal?
What information do I actually need, versus what I'm using as an excuse to stall?
What would I choose if I trusted myself?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Make the difficult decision. Choose one option and take the first action toward it.
direct_guidance.relationships: Choose the hard conversation over comfortable silence. Decide and communicate.
direct_guidance.work: Stop waiting for perfect information. Decide with what you have and adjust.
direct_guidance.money: Make the financial decision you're avoiding. Choose and commit.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either finally deciding or more paralyzed. Recalibrate: follow through if choosing, pick imperfectly if stuck.
direct_guidance.shadow: Decision avoidance, false neutrality, or overthinking as procrastination.
direct_guidance.mantra: I see the truth. I choose. I move forward.
direct_guidance.quick: Face the decision directly. Choose, don't stall. Next 24h: Make the difficult decision and take first action.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Two of Swords sits blindfolded holding crossed blades over turbulent water. Remove the blindfold. Choose. Move.

lenses.relationships: Choose the hard conversation over comfortable silence. Decide and communicate.
lenses.work: Stop waiting for perfect information. Decide with what you have and adjust.
lenses.money: Make the financial decision you're avoiding. Choose and commit.

name: Three of Swords

numerology.meaning: Three is heartbreak and painful truth—the moment when what you feared is confirmed and your heart breaks open.

upright.meaning: Your heart is breaking because the truth is unavoidable now. This pain is legitimate. In practice: feel it fully. Don't numb it, don't rush past it. Grieve what's real.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'it hurts because it's true' card. The pain is legitimate. Feel it.
voice.pulse: Three of Swords upright is heartbreak from truth—pain that comes from finally seeing clearly.
voice.turn: Name the painful truth out loud. Cry if you need to. Don't skip the grief.

reversed.meaning: Either you're healing from heartbreak (pain easing), or you're refusing to feel it (numbing, denying). In practice: if healing, keep going. If numbing, let yourself feel.

voice.lead_in: Three of Swords reversed asks: is your heart mending, or are you refusing to let it break?
voice.pulse: This is the 'healing or denial' card—either recovery beginning or pain suppressed.
voice.turn: If healing: acknowledge one way you're better than before. If numbing: let yourself cry about it.

guidance: Feel the heartbreak fully. Don't rush past necessary grief.
call_to_action: Name the painful truth. Let yourself feel it completely without numbing.

direct_guidance.do: Feel the pain fully. Grieve what's lost. Speak the painful truth out loud.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't numb the pain or rush to 'move on,' and don't wallow without eventually processing.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Toxic positivity bypassing real grief, or wallowing without healing.
questions: What painful truth am I finally admitting?
Am I letting myself feel this, or am I numbing it?
What do I need to grieve before I can move forward?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Write out the painful truth. Cry, rage, or sit with it. Don't rush past the feeling.
direct_guidance.relationships: Acknowledge when love hurts. Betrayal, loss, and heartbreak are real—feel them.
direct_guidance.work: Face painful professional truths—failure, rejection, or betrayal. Process before pivoting.
direct_guidance.money: Acknowledge financial heartbreak honestly. Bad investments and losses hurt—grieve them.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either healing or denying. Recalibrate: keep healing if recovering, feel fully if numbing.
direct_guidance.shadow: Emotional numbness, toxic positivity, or chronic victimhood through heartbreak.
direct_guidance.mantra: I feel the truth. I grieve what's real.
direct_guidance.quick: Feel the pain fully. Grieve what's lost. Speak painful truth. Next 24h: Write it out, cry, sit with it.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Three of Swords shows three blades piercing a heart in the rain. It's not metaphor. It actually hurts. Feel it.

lenses.relationships: Acknowledge when love hurts. Betrayal, loss, and heartbreak are real—feel them.
lenses.work: Face painful professional truths—failure, rejection, or betrayal. Process before pivoting.
lenses.money: Acknowledge financial heartbreak honestly. Bad investments and losses hurt—grieve them.

name: Four of Swords

numerology.meaning: Four is rest and recuperation—necessary pause after mental or physical exhaustion.

upright.meaning: You need rest. Not 'taking a break'—actual recuperation. Your mind or body is depleted. In practice: stop. Rest deeply. Recover before you crash completely.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'mandatory rest' card. You're depleted. Stop moving. Recover.
voice.pulse: Four of Swords upright is necessary pause—rest that's required, not optional.
voice.turn: Cancel one thing today. Rest properly—no phone, no work, just recovery.

reversed.meaning: Either you're recovering and ready to re-engage (rest complete), or you're refusing to rest when you desperately need it. In practice: if recovered, act. If resisting rest, stop immediately.

voice.lead_in: Four of Swords reversed asks: are you recovered and ready, or are you pushing when you need rest?
voice.pulse: This is the 'recovered or refusing rest' card—either ready to go or heading for burnout.
voice.turn: If recovered: re-engage with one small action. If resisting rest: stop everything for 24 hours.

guidance: Stop. Rest deeply. Recover before you crash completely.
call_to_action: Take one full day of real rest. No productivity. Just recovery.

direct_guidance.do: Rest deeply and without guilt. Recover fully before re-engaging.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't push through exhaustion, and don't use 'rest' to avoid necessary action when recovered.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Burnout from refusing rest, or using 'rest' as avoidance when you're actually recovered.
questions: Am I actually resting, or am I just 'being busy' differently?
What would real recovery look like for me right now?
Am I resting because I need it, or avoiding something I'm ready to face?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Take one full day off. No work, no productivity, no guilt. Just rest.
direct_guidance.relationships: Take space from intense relationship dynamics. Rest doesn't mean abandonment.
direct_guidance.work: Rest is productive. Burnout makes you useless. Take the break before you're forced to.
direct_guidance.money: Don't make financial decisions when mentally exhausted. Rest first, decide later.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either recovered or refusing rest. Recalibrate: re-engage if ready, stop completely if exhausted.
direct_guidance.shadow: Burnout from refusing rest, or chronic rest as avoidance of life.
direct_guidance.mantra: I rest without guilt. I recover fully.
direct_guidance.quick: Rest deeply and without guilt. Recover fully. Next 24h: Take one full day off—no work, no guilt.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Four of Swords shows a figure lying in rest, swords above in waiting. Rest now. Fight later. You'll need your strength.

lenses.relationships: Take space from intense relationship dynamics. Rest doesn't mean abandonment.
lenses.work: Rest is productive. Burnout makes you useless. Take the break before you're forced to.
lenses.money: Don't make financial decisions when mentally exhausted. Rest first, decide later.

name: Five of Swords

numerology.meaning: Five is defeat and hollow victory—winning the battle while losing something more important.

upright.meaning: You won the argument but lost the relationship. Or you lost and it stings. Either way, conflict has a cost. In practice: assess what winning or losing actually cost you. Was it worth it?

voice.lead_in: This is the 'pyrrhic victory' card. You won. But look at the wreckage.
voice.pulse: Five of Swords upright is conflict's cost—winning or losing, someone pays the price.
voice.turn: Name what the conflict cost you. Decide if it was worth it. Then choose differently next time.

reversed.meaning: Either you're making amends (acknowledging the damage), or you're still fighting battles that don't matter. In practice: if making peace, good. If still fighting, walk away.

voice.lead_in: Five of Swords reversed asks: are you healing the damage, or still picking fights you can't win?
voice.pulse: This is the 'making amends or chronic conflict' card—either reconciliation or endless combat.
voice.turn: If making amends: apologize sincerely today. If still fighting: name one battle to abandon.

guidance: Assess conflict's true cost. Decide if winning was worth what you lost.
call_to_action: Make amends for one conflict. Apologize or let the fight go.

direct_guidance.do: Assess the true cost of conflict. Walk away from battles that cost more than they're worth.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't win arguments at the cost of relationships, and don't fight battles that don't matter.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Being 'right' but alone, or fighting for ego instead of values.
questions: What did winning this fight actually cost me?
Am I fighting to protect something real, or just to be right?
Which battles are worth fighting, and which should I walk away from?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Either apologize for one conflict you escalated, or walk away from one pointless battle.
direct_guidance.relationships: Being right isn't worth being alone. Choose connection over correctness.
direct_guidance.work: Pick your battles. Not every disagreement needs a winner.
direct_guidance.money: Don't fight over money if it costs you relationships that matter more.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either making amends or still fighting. Recalibrate: reconcile if ready, walk away if toxic.
direct_guidance.shadow: Needing to win at all costs, or staying in chronic conflict to feel alive.
direct_guidance.mantra: I choose my battles. I assess the cost.
direct_guidance.quick: Assess conflict's true cost. Walk away from battles not worth fighting. Next 24h: Apologize or abandon one fight.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Five of Swords shows someone holding three swords while two others walk away. You won. Are you proud? Or alone?

lenses.relationships: Being right isn't worth being alone. Choose connection over correctness.
lenses.work: Pick your battles. Not every disagreement needs a winner.
lenses.money: Don't fight over money if it costs you relationships that matter more.

name: Six of Swords

numerology.meaning: Six is transition and passage—moving from turbulent waters to calmer shores, carrying what you've learned.

upright.meaning: You're in transition—leaving difficult circumstances for something calmer. Not fixed yet, but moving in the right direction. In practice: keep going. Trust the passage even if you're not there yet.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'moving toward calmer waters' card. Not there yet. But going the right direction.
voice.pulse: Six of Swords upright is intentional transition—leaving chaos for calm, one stroke at a time.
voice.turn: Take one step away from what's chaotic and toward what's calmer. Trust the process.

reversed.meaning: Either you're stuck in transition (can't commit to leaving), or you're rushing forward without processing what happened. In practice: if stuck, commit to leaving. If rushing, pause and integrate lessons.

voice.lead_in: Six of Swords reversed asks: are you refusing to leave, or are you running without healing?
voice.pulse: This is the 'stuck or rushing' card—either can't commit to change or fleeing without learning.
voice.turn: If stuck: take one concrete step toward leaving today. If rushing: pause and write what you learned.

guidance: Move toward calmer waters. Trust the transition even if you're not there yet.
call_to_action: Take one step away from chaos and toward peace. Keep moving.

direct_guidance.do: Commit to the transition. Move deliberately toward calm. Trust the passage.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't stay stuck in chaos, and don't rush forward without processing lessons.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Staying in bad situations out of fear, or running to the next thing without healing.
questions: What am I leaving behind, and where am I heading?
Am I in transition, or am I stuck refusing to leave?
What lessons from the chaos do I need to carry forward?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Take one concrete action that moves you from current chaos toward something calmer.
direct_guidance.relationships: Leave relationships that harm you. Move toward connections that feel peaceful.
direct_guidance.work: Transition from toxic work environments. Trust that calmer professional waters exist.
direct_guidance.money: Move away from financial chaos through disciplined decisions—one step at a time.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either stuck or rushing. Recalibrate: commit to leaving if stuck, pause to integrate if fleeing.
direct_guidance.shadow: Refusing to leave bad situations, or chronic running without ever settling.
direct_guidance.mantra: I move toward calm. I trust the passage.
direct_guidance.quick: Move toward calmer waters. Trust the transition. Next 24h: Take one step from chaos toward peace.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Six of Swords shows a boat crossing from rough to calm water. You're rowing. Keep going. The far shore is real.

lenses.relationships: Leave relationships that harm you. Move toward connections that feel peaceful.
lenses.work: Transition from toxic work environments. Trust that calmer professional waters exist.
lenses.money: Move away from financial chaos through disciplined decisions—one step at a time.

name: Seven of Swords

numerology.meaning: Seven is strategy and cunning—sometimes wisdom, sometimes deception. The line between cleverness and betrayal.

upright.meaning: Someone's being strategic—maybe you, maybe them. Not necessarily bad, but not fully honest either. In practice: check your motives. Strategic or sneaky? Wise or manipulative?

voice.lead_in: This is the 'what are you not saying' card. Strategy or deception? Check yourself.
voice.pulse: Seven of Swords upright is cunning—the knife edge between smart strategy and outright betrayal.
voice.turn: Name one thing you're withholding or manipulating. Get honest about your motives.

reversed.meaning: Either you're getting caught (deception exposed), or you're done with games (choosing honesty). In practice: if caught, come clean. If choosing honesty, follow through.

voice.lead_in: Seven of Swords reversed asks: are you getting caught, or are you finally being honest?
voice.pulse: This is the 'exposed or transparent' card—either lies revealed or truth chosen.
voice.turn: If caught: confess before you're forced to. If honest: tell one truth you've been hiding.

guidance: Check your motives. Choose strategic honesty over manipulation.
call_to_action: Get honest about one thing you're manipulating or withholding. Come clean.

direct_guidance.do: Be strategic but honest. Use intelligence without manipulation.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't deceive to get ahead, and don't confuse strategy with betrayal.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Manipulation disguised as cleverness, or lies of omission that become betrayal.
questions: What am I withholding or manipulating right now?
Am I being strategic or deceptive—and what's the difference?
If this comes out, will I be proud of how I handled it?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Get honest about one thing you're being sneaky about. Either come clean or stop doing it.
direct_guidance.relationships: Secrets and manipulation poison connection. Be strategic about timing, not about truth.
direct_guidance.work: Smart strategy is fine. Backstabbing and deception aren't. Know the line.
direct_guidance.money: Don't cut corners or deceive to get ahead financially. It will catch up.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either getting caught or choosing honesty. Recalibrate: confess if exposed, follow through if transparent.
direct_guidance.shadow: Deception, betrayal, manipulation disguised as intelligence.
direct_guidance.mantra: I'm strategic. I'm honest. I know the difference.
direct_guidance.quick: Check your motives. Choose strategic honesty over manipulation. Next 24h: Get honest about one sneaky thing.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Seven of Swords shows someone sneaking away with swords, leaving two behind. Clever? Or betrayal? You know which.

lenses.relationships: Secrets and manipulation poison connection. Be strategic about timing, not about truth.
lenses.work: Smart strategy is fine. Backstabbing and deception aren't. Know the line.
lenses.money: Don't cut corners or deceive to get ahead financially. It will catch up.

name: Eight of Swords

numerology.meaning: Eight is restriction and mental imprisonment—bound by thoughts, beliefs, or fears that feel like reality but aren't.

upright.meaning: You feel trapped but the bindings are loose. Your mind created this cage. In practice: test your assumptions. Walk forward. You're more free than you think.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'the cage is unlocked' card. You're bound by beliefs, not reality.
voice.pulse: Eight of Swords upright is mental imprisonment—restrictions that exist in your mind, not the world.
voice.turn: Name one limiting belief. Test it today—take one action that breaks the rule.

reversed.meaning: Either you're freeing yourself (removing the blindfold, testing the bonds), or you're sinking deeper into victimhood. In practice: if freeing, keep going. If victimizing, take one tiny step toward agency.

voice.lead_in: Eight of Swords reversed asks: are you breaking free, or are you deciding you're helpless?
voice.pulse: This is the 'liberation or victimhood' card—either removing mental chains or tightening them.
voice.turn: If freeing: take one action you 'couldn't' do before. If victimizing: name one thing within your control.

guidance: Test your limiting beliefs. Walk forward. You're more free than you think.
call_to_action: Do one thing you believe you 'can't' do. Test if the restriction is real.

direct_guidance.do: Question limiting beliefs. Test mental restrictions. Walk forward despite fear.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't accept mental prisons as reality, and don't use 'I can't' without testing it.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Learned helplessness, or using 'I can't' to avoid 'I don't want to.'
questions: What do I believe I 'can't' do that I've never actually tested?
Are these restrictions real, or am I creating them in my mind?
What would I do if I knew I was free?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Do one small thing you believe you 'can't' do. Test if the cage is real.
direct_guidance.relationships: Don't stay trapped by assumptions about what someone will say or do. Ask directly.
direct_guidance.work: Test career limitations—apply for the 'impossible' role, pitch the 'too big' idea.
direct_guidance.money: Challenge financial beliefs—'I can't save,' 'I'm bad with money.' Test them.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either liberating yourself or sinking into victimhood. Recalibrate: keep testing if freeing, act on one thing if stuck.
direct_guidance.shadow: Learned helplessness, chronic victimhood, or using limitation as identity.
direct_guidance.mantra: I test my limits. I walk forward. I'm free.
direct_guidance.quick: Question limiting beliefs. Test restrictions. Walk forward. Next 24h: Do one thing you believe you 'can't.'
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Eight of Swords shows a bound, blindfolded figure surrounded by swords. The bindings are loose. The path is clear. Walk.

lenses.relationships: Don't stay trapped by assumptions about what someone will say or do. Ask directly.
lenses.work: Test career limitations—apply for the 'impossible' role, pitch the 'too big' idea.
lenses.money: Challenge financial beliefs—'I can't save,' 'I'm bad with money.' Test them.

name: Nine of Swords

numerology.meaning: Nine is anxiety and mental torment—the 3am thoughts that spiral into worst-case scenarios.

upright.meaning: Your mind is torturing you with worst-case scenarios. Most of it isn't real. In practice: write down the fears. Test which are actual problems versus anxiety spirals.

voice.lead_in: This is the '3am spiral' card. Your mind is catastrophizing. Most of it isn't real.
voice.pulse: Nine of Swords upright is mental anguish—anxiety creating problems that don't exist yet.
voice.turn: Write down every fear. Circle which are actual current problems. Most won't be.

reversed.meaning: Either anxiety is lifting (worst is over, mind calming), or you're in denial about real problems. In practice: if lifting, keep healing. If denying, face one real issue.

voice.lead_in: Nine of Swords reversed asks: is your mind calming, or are you avoiding real problems through denial?
voice.pulse: This is the 'recovery or denial' card—either anxiety easing or refusing to see actual issues.
voice.turn: If recovering: celebrate one night of better sleep. If denying: name one real problem you're avoiding.

guidance: Write down the fears. Test which are real versus anxiety spirals.
call_to_action: List all your worries. Separate real problems from anxiety spirals. Address one real thing.

direct_guidance.do: Acknowledge anxiety without believing every thought. Test fears against reality.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't let anxiety spirals paralyze you, and don't use 'staying positive' to deny real problems.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Anxiety creating problems that don't exist, or denial disguised as 'not worrying.'
questions: Which of my fears are real problems, and which are anxiety spirals?
What's the worst that could actually happen—versus what my anxiety says?
Am I catastrophizing, or is there a real issue I need to address?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Write down all worries. Mark which are real. Do one small thing about one real problem.
direct_guidance.relationships: Anxiety creates relationship problems through catastrophizing. Check what's actually happening.
direct_guidance.work: Don't let anxiety about failure prevent you from trying. Test your fears.
direct_guidance.money: Separate real financial problems from anxiety about money. Address what's actually true.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means anxiety is either lifting or you're in denial. Recalibrate: keep healing if better, face reality if avoiding.
direct_guidance.shadow: Chronic anxiety, catastrophizing, or using worry to feel prepared.
direct_guidance.mantra: I see what's real. I breathe. I act on what I can control.
direct_guidance.quick: Write down fears. Test which are real. Address one actual problem. Next 24h: List worries, mark real ones, act on one.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Nine of Swords shows someone sitting up in bed, head in hands, nine swords above. Your mind is the enemy. Test the thoughts.

lenses.relationships: Anxiety creates relationship problems through catastrophizing. Check what's actually happening.
lenses.work: Don't let anxiety about failure prevent you from trying. Test your fears.
lenses.money: Separate real financial problems from anxiety about money. Address what's actually true.

name: Ten of Swords

numerology.meaning: Ten is rock bottom and completion—the worst has happened. Now the only way is up.

theme: rock bottom, betrayal, hitting the end

upright.meaning: This is as bad as it gets. The worst happened. You're done. In practice: acknowledge rock bottom. Grieve. Then get up—the only way from here is forward.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'it's over' card. Rock bottom. The worst happened. Now you rebuild.
voice.pulse: Ten of Swords upright is brutal completion—the end that clears space for something new.
voice.turn: Say it out loud: 'That's done. I'm done. Now I begin again.' Then take one tiny step forward.

reversed.meaning: Either you're recovering from rock bottom (worst is over, healing beginning), or you're dramatizing to avoid actual change. In practice: if recovering, keep going. If dramatizing, get real about what you need to do.

voice.lead_in: Ten of Swords reversed asks: are you rising from the wreckage, or are you performing victimhood?
voice.pulse: This is the 'recovery or drama' card—either genuinely healing or using crisis to avoid growth.
voice.turn: If recovering: do one thing the 'old you' couldn't. If dramatizing: take one unglamorous action toward change.

guidance: Acknowledge rock bottom. Grieve. Then get up—the only way is forward.
call_to_action: Name what's over. Grieve it. Then take one small step toward something new.

direct_guidance.do: Acknowledge when something is truly over. Grieve. Then begin rebuilding from zero.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't wallow in victimhood, and don't skip the grief by forcing positivity too soon.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Dramatizing crisis for attention, or refusing to move on from rock bottom.
questions: What is actually over that I need to accept?
Am I grieving, or am I performing crisis?
What's the one small thing I can do to move forward from here?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Declare one thing over. Grieve it briefly. Then do one tiny thing toward what's next.
direct_guidance.relationships: When a relationship is dead, accept it. Grieve. Don't resurrect what's over.
direct_guidance.work: Failed projects teach lessons. Learn them. Then start something new from scratch.
direct_guidance.money: Financial rock bottom is real. Accept it without shame. Rebuild from here.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either recovering or dramatizing. Recalibrate: keep rising if healing, get real if performing.
direct_guidance.shadow: Chronic victimhood, dramatizing crisis, or refusing to move on from rock bottom.
direct_guidance.mantra: It's over. I grieve. I rise.
direct_guidance.quick: Acknowledge rock bottom. Grieve. Begin rebuilding. Next 24h: Declare one thing over, then take one step forward.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Ten of Swords shows a figure with ten blades in their back at dawn. The worst happened. The sun's rising. Get up.

lenses.relationships: When a relationship is dead, accept it. Grieve. Don't resurrect what's over.
lenses.work: Failed projects teach lessons. Learn them. Then start something new from scratch.
lenses.money: Financial rock bottom is real. Accept it without shame. Rebuild from here.

name: Page of Swords

numerology.meaning: Page is curious intelligence—eager to learn, ask questions, and speak truth even when inexperienced.

upright.meaning: You're curious, asking questions, learning how to think and speak clearly. Beginner's mind in the mental realm. In practice: ask questions, challenge assumptions, speak up even if you're new.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'ask everything' card. Be curious. Question. Speak truth even as a beginner.
voice.pulse: Page of Swords upright is eager intelligence—curiosity that asks questions without needing all answers.
voice.turn: Ask one question today that others are afraid to ask. Challenge one assumption.

reversed.meaning: Either you're all talk and no action (clever without substance), or you're gossiping instead of speaking truth. In practice: if shallow, add substance. If gossiping, speak directly.

voice.lead_in: Page of Swords reversed asks: are you being clever without depth, or spreading gossip instead of truth?
voice.pulse: This is the 'all talk or gossip' card—either intellectual posturing or malicious communication.
voice.turn: If shallow: learn one thing deeply today. If gossiping: speak to the person directly instead.

guidance: Be curious. Ask questions. Speak truth even as a beginner.
call_to_action: Ask one question everyone else is avoiding. Challenge one assumption directly.

direct_guidance.do: Ask questions freely. Challenge assumptions. Speak truth even when inexperienced.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't be clever without substance, and don't gossip instead of communicating directly.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Intellectual posturing without depth, or using words to manipulate rather than clarify.
questions: What question am I afraid to ask?
Am I being genuinely curious, or just trying to sound smart?
What truth needs to be spoken that I'm avoiding?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Ask one question no one else is asking. Speak one truth that feels risky.
direct_guidance.relationships: Ask questions instead of making assumptions. Communicate directly, not through others.
direct_guidance.work: Challenge ideas respectfully. Ask 'why' when things don't make sense.
direct_guidance.money: Question financial advice. Ask how things actually work. Be intelligently curious.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either shallow or gossiping. Recalibrate: add depth if posturing, speak directly if gossiping.
direct_guidance.shadow: Intellectual posturing, gossip, using cleverness to manipulate.
direct_guidance.mantra: I ask. I question. I speak truth.
direct_guidance.quick: Be curious. Ask questions. Speak truth. Next 24h: Ask one avoided question, challenge one assumption.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Page of Swords holds a sword high, alert and ready. Curious. Questioning. Eager to cut through confusion with truth.

lenses.relationships: Ask questions instead of making assumptions. Communicate directly, not through others.
lenses.work: Challenge ideas respectfully. Ask 'why' when things don't make sense.
lenses.money: Question financial advice. Ask how things actually work. Be intelligently curious.

name: Knight of Swords

numerology.meaning: Knight is swift action and decisive thinking—charging forward with clarity and speed, sometimes recklessly.

upright.meaning: Act decisively and quickly. You see the truth—now move on it fast. In practice: make the decision, take the action, don't overthink. Speed matters here.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'charge forward' card. You know what to do. Do it fast.
voice.pulse: Knight of Swords upright is decisive speed—clarity followed by immediate action.
voice.turn: Make one fast decision today. Then act on it immediately without second-guessing.

reversed.meaning: Either you're reckless (acting without thinking), or you're all planning and no execution. In practice: if reckless, pause to think. If stalling, act now.

voice.lead_in: Knight of Swords reversed asks: are you charging blindly, or are you overthinking to avoid action?
voice.pulse: This is the 'reckless or paralyzed' card—either no thought or no action.
voice.turn: If reckless: pause for one hour before deciding. If overthinking: make the decision in the next 10 minutes.

guidance: Act decisively and quickly. Clarity + speed = results.
call_to_action: Make one fast decision. Act on it immediately without second-guessing.

direct_guidance.do: Act decisively. Move quickly once you see clearly. Don't overthink obvious moves.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't be reckless without thought, and don't overthink to the point of paralysis.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Impulsiveness disguised as decisiveness, or analysis paralysis disguised as 'being thorough.'
questions: Do I see clearly enough to act, or am I moving too fast?
Am I being decisive or reckless?
What obvious action am I overthinking?
direct_guidance.next_24h: See clearly, then act fast. Make one decision and execute it within one hour.
direct_guidance.relationships: Have the hard conversation now. Don't overthink—say what needs saying.
direct_guidance.work: Make decisions quickly once you have enough information. Speed is competitive advantage.
direct_guidance.money: Act on clear financial opportunities quickly. Don't overthink obvious moves.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either reckless or overthinking. Recalibrate: pause if charging blindly, act if paralyzed.
direct_guidance.shadow: Recklessness, impulsiveness, or chronic overthinking that prevents all action.
direct_guidance.mantra: I see clearly. I act fast. I adjust as I go.
direct_guidance.quick: Act decisively and quickly. Clarity + speed = results. Next 24h: Make one decision, act on it within one hour.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Knight of Swords charges on a galloping horse, sword raised. Fast. Clear. Decisive. Don't overthink—move.

lenses.relationships: Have the hard conversation now. Don't overthink—say what needs saying.
lenses.work: Make decisions quickly once you have enough information. Speed is competitive advantage.
lenses.money: Act on clear financial opportunities quickly. Don't overthink obvious moves.

name: Queen of Swords

numerology.meaning: Queen is clear-minded discernment—able to see truth and speak it with both precision and compassion.

theme: clear discernment, truthful communication, wise boundaries

upright.meaning: You see through bullshit and speak truth with clarity. Compassionate but never unclear. In practice: communicate directly. Set boundaries with kindness. See and speak what's true.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'clear and kind' card. Speak truth. No bullshit. But with heart.
voice.pulse: Queen of Swords upright is discerning wisdom—truth spoken with clarity and compassion.
voice.turn: Say one clear truth with kindness today. No sugar-coating, no cruelty—just honest.

reversed.meaning: Either you're cold and cruel (using truth as a weapon), or you're clouded by bitterness. In practice: if cruel, add compassion. If bitter, heal your hurt.

voice.lead_in: Queen of Swords reversed asks: are you using truth to wound, or has pain made you bitter?
voice.pulse: This is the 'cruel or bitter' card—either weaponized honesty or wounded coldness.
voice.turn: If cruel: speak one truth with genuine compassion. If bitter: name your hurt and begin healing.

guidance: See truth clearly. Speak it directly. Add compassion to your clarity.
call_to_action: Say one clear truth with kindness. No bullshit, no cruelty—just honest.

direct_guidance.do: Speak truth directly and clearly. Set boundaries with kindness. See through manipulation.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't use honesty to wound, and don't let hurt make you bitter or cold.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Cruelty disguised as honesty, or bitterness that clouds clear thinking.
questions: Am I speaking truth to help or to hurt?
Where am I letting bitterness cloud my judgment?
Can I be both clear and kind in this moment?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Communicate one difficult truth with both clarity and compassion. Mean it.
direct_guidance.relationships: Set boundaries clearly and kindly. Don't tolerate manipulation, but don't weaponize truth.
direct_guidance.work: Give clear feedback. Be direct about problems. Add empathy without softening truth.
direct_guidance.money: See financial reality clearly. Make decisions from discernment, not fear or greed.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either cruel or bitter. Recalibrate: add compassion if harsh, heal hurt if cold.
direct_guidance.shadow: Using truth as a weapon, bitterness from past pain, or coldness disguised as clarity.
direct_guidance.mantra: I see clearly. I speak truth. I stay kind.
direct_guidance.quick: Speak truth directly and clearly. Set boundaries with kindness. Next 24h: Say one difficult truth with clarity and compassion.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Queen of Swords sits with sword raised, cloud above. Clear-eyed. Direct. Kind. Truth without cruelty. That's mastery.

lenses.relationships: Set boundaries clearly and kindly. Don't tolerate manipulation, but don't weaponize truth.
lenses.work: Give clear feedback. Be direct about problems. Add empathy without softening truth.
lenses.money: See financial reality clearly. Make decisions from discernment, not fear or greed.

name: King of Swords

numerology.meaning: King is intellectual mastery—commanding truth with authority, logic with wisdom, justice with clarity.

theme: intellectual authority, logical mastery, just leadership

upright.meaning: You command through clarity, logic, and fair judgment. Lead with your mind. Make decisions from reason tempered by ethics. In practice: think clearly, decide fairly, lead with intellectual integrity.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'fair judge' card. Think clearly. Decide fairly. Lead with reason and ethics.
voice.pulse: King of Swords upright is intellectual command—logic, justice, and clarity in service of truth.
voice.turn: Make one important decision from pure logic and ethics today. No emotion, just fair reasoning.

reversed.meaning: Either you're tyrannical (using logic to control), or you're intellectually dishonest (manipulating truth). In practice: if tyrannical, soften. If dishonest, get truthful.

voice.lead_in: King of Swords reversed asks: are you using logic to control, or twisting truth to manipulate?
voice.pulse: This is the 'tyrant or liar' card—either cold control or intellectual dishonesty.
voice.turn: If tyrannical: lead with fairness, not domination. If dishonest: speak one truth you've been twisting.

guidance: Think clearly. Decide fairly. Lead with intellectual integrity and ethics.
call_to_action: Make one decision from clear logic and ethics. Be the fair judge.

direct_guidance.do: Lead with clarity, logic, and fair judgment. Make ethical decisions. Think before acting.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't use logic to control people, and don't twist truth to win arguments.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Tyranny through intellectual superiority, or rationalization that serves ego instead of truth.
questions: Am I leading with clarity and fairness, or using logic to control?
What's the most ethical decision here, even if it's uncomfortable?
Am I thinking clearly, or rationalizing what I want?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Make one important decision using only logic and ethics. Remove emotion. Decide fairly.
direct_guidance.relationships: Lead with fairness and clear communication. Don't use logic as a weapon or control tool.
direct_guidance.work: Make decisions from reason and ethics. Lead with clarity. Be the fair authority.
direct_guidance.money: Think strategically. Make logical financial decisions. Don't let emotion override reason.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either tyrannical or dishonest. Recalibrate: soften if controlling, truth if manipulating.
direct_guidance.shadow: Intellectual tyranny, using logic to control, or rationalizing unethical choices.
direct_guidance.mantra: I think clearly. I judge fairly. I lead with integrity.
direct_guidance.quick: Think clearly. Decide fairly. Lead with intellectual integrity. Next 24h: Make one decision from pure logic and ethics.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: King of Swords sits enthroned, sword upright. Clear-eyed judge. Fair authority. Logic and ethics. No compromise on truth.

lenses.relationships: Lead with fairness and clear communication. Don't use logic as a weapon or control tool.
lenses.work: Make decisions from reason and ethics. Lead with clarity. Be the fair authority.
lenses.money: Think strategically. Make logical financial decisions. Don't let emotion override reason.

name: Ace of Wands

numerology.meaning: One is the spark—pure creative potential, the fire that wants to become something real.

upright.meaning: A spark of inspiration is here—creative, passionate, ready to ignite. This is pure potential wanting to become real. In practice: say yes to the idea. Start it now while the fire is hot.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'lightning strike of inspiration' card. The spark is here. Light the fire.
voice.pulse: Ace of Wands upright is creative ignition—inspiration that demands immediate action.
voice.turn: Start one thing today that excites you. Don't wait. The fire is lit—feed it.

reversed.meaning: Either the spark won't catch (false starts, lack of passion), or you're ignoring inspiration out of fear. In practice: if false start, try something else. If ignoring, act on what excites you.

voice.lead_in: Ace of Wands reversed asks: is the spark genuine but you're afraid, or is this the wrong fire?
voice.pulse: This is the 'dampened fire or wrong spark' card—either fear killing inspiration or pursuing what doesn't ignite you.
voice.turn: If afraid: do one small thing toward the idea. If wrong spark: name what actually excites you.

guidance: Say yes to inspiration. Start while the fire is hot. Feed the spark.
call_to_action: Begin one inspired project today. Don't overthink—just start.

direct_guidance.do: Act on inspiration immediately. Start bold projects. Feed creative fire with action.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't let fear kill inspiration, and don't chase ideas that don't genuinely excite you.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Letting perfect planning kill the spark, or forcing passion for ideas that feel flat.
questions: What idea is sparking in me that I'm afraid to start?
Is this genuine inspiration, or am I forcing it?
What would I create if I knew I couldn't fail?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Take the first action on one inspired idea—write the first page, make the call, start the sketch.
direct_guidance.relationships: Pursue connection that genuinely excites you. Don't fake passion you don't feel.
direct_guidance.work: Start the bold project. Launch the creative idea. Act on what inspires you.
direct_guidance.money: Invest in ventures that genuinely excite you. Passion creates better returns than logic alone.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means the spark won't catch or you're blocking it. Recalibrate: try something else if false, act if afraid.
direct_guidance.shadow: Fear killing inspiration, or chasing 'should' ideas that don't actually ignite you.
direct_guidance.mantra: I feel the spark. I light the fire. I begin.
direct_guidance.quick: Act on inspiration immediately. Start bold projects. Next 24h: Take first action on one inspired idea.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Ace of Wands is a hand offering a blooming staff. Pure creative potential. Take it. Start now. The fire wants to burn.

lenses.relationships: Pursue connection that genuinely excites you. Don't fake passion you don't feel.
lenses.work: Start the bold project. Launch the creative idea. Act on what inspires you.
lenses.money: Invest in ventures that genuinely excite you. Passion creates better returns than logic alone.

name: Two of Wands

numerology.meaning: Two is vision and planning—holding the world in your hands, deciding where to direct your fire.

upright.meaning: You've got the vision and you're planning the path. The world is in your hands—now choose where to aim. In practice: plan strategically. Then commit to one direction and move.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'planning the empire' card. You see the potential. Now pick your path.
voice.pulse: Two of Wands upright is strategic vision—planning bold moves from a position of power.
voice.turn: Write down your biggest vision. Pick one path toward it. Take first step today.

reversed.meaning: Either you're stuck in planning (analysis paralysis), or you're ignoring the need to plan (reckless action). In practice: if stuck, pick a direction. If reckless, make a plan.

voice.lead_in: Two of Wands reversed asks: are you planning forever without moving, or moving without any plan?
voice.pulse: This is the 'eternal planning or no plan' card—either won't commit or won't think ahead.
voice.turn: If stuck planning: choose one path and take first action. If reckless: write a one-page plan before moving.

guidance: Plan strategically. Pick your direction. Then commit and move.
call_to_action: Choose one bold direction. Make a plan. Take the first step.

direct_guidance.do: Envision boldly. Plan strategically. Then commit to one direction and move.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't plan forever without acting, and don't act boldly without any strategic thought.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Analysis paralysis disguised as 'being strategic,' or recklessness disguised as 'bold vision.'
questions: What's my biggest vision right now?
Am I planning to prepare, or planning to avoid committing?
Which direction am I actually willing to walk?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Write your vision in one paragraph. Pick one direction. Take one action toward it.
direct_guidance.relationships: Envision the relationship you want. Discuss the path. Then commit to building it.
direct_guidance.work: Plan your career move strategically. Pick the path. Then execute boldly.
direct_guidance.money: Envision financial goals. Create strategy. Then act on the plan with commitment.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either stuck planning or acting recklessly. Recalibrate: move if stuck, plan if reckless.
direct_guidance.shadow: Chronic planning without commitment, or bold action without strategic thinking.
direct_guidance.mantra: I envision. I plan. I commit.
direct_guidance.quick: Plan strategically. Pick direction. Commit and move. Next 24h: Write vision, pick path, take first step.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Two of Wands holds a globe while standing between two staffs. The world is yours. Pick where you're going. Then go.

lenses.relationships: Envision the relationship you want. Discuss the path. Then commit to building it.
lenses.work: Plan your career move strategically. Pick the path. Then execute boldly.
lenses.money: Envision financial goals. Create strategy. Then act on the plan with commitment.

name: Three of Wands

numerology.meaning: Three is expansion and momentum—ships have sailed, results are coming, vision is manifesting into reality.

upright.meaning: You planted the seeds and now things are growing. Ships have sailed—results are coming. In practice: trust the momentum. Keep expanding. Stay ready for what returns.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'ships at sea' card. You did the work. Now watch what comes back.
voice.pulse: Three of Wands upright is creative momentum—expansion in motion, results on the horizon.
voice.turn: Identify one thing you set in motion. Trust it's working. Prepare for what's returning.

reversed.meaning: Either momentum is stalling (delays, obstacles), or you're expanding too fast (overextending). In practice: if stalling, add energy. If overextending, consolidate.

voice.lead_in: Three of Wands reversed asks: is momentum stalling, or are you expanding beyond your capacity?
voice.pulse: This is the 'stalled expansion or overextension' card—either can't build momentum or building too fast.
voice.turn: If stalling: add new energy to one stalled project. If overextending: say no to one thing.

guidance: Trust the momentum. Keep expanding strategically. Prepare for returns.
call_to_action: Add energy to one expanding project. Trust what's in motion.

direct_guidance.do: Trust momentum. Expand strategically. Prepare for results returning.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't let expansion stall, and don't overextend beyond sustainable capacity.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Losing momentum through doubt, or expanding so fast you can't maintain quality.
questions: What have I set in motion that's building momentum?
Am I trusting the process, or am I trying to control every detail?
Am I expanding at a sustainable pace, or am I overextending?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Add energy to one expanding project—make a connection, add resources, fuel the fire.
direct_guidance.relationships: Let relationships expand naturally. Trust momentum. Don't force or control growth.
direct_guidance.work: Expand your reach—new markets, new projects, new partnerships. Trust the momentum.
direct_guidance.money: Expand income streams. Diversify. Trust investments to grow—don't micromanage.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means momentum is either stalling or overextending. Recalibrate: fuel if stalled, consolidate if too fast.
direct_guidance.shadow: Losing momentum through fear, or reckless expansion that can't be sustained.
direct_guidance.mantra: I trust the momentum. I expand wisely.
direct_guidance.quick: Trust momentum. Expand strategically. Prepare for returns. Next 24h: Add energy to one expanding project.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Three of Wands watches ships sail toward horizon. You planted. You launched. Now trust the journey. Results are coming.

lenses.relationships: Let relationships expand naturally. Trust momentum. Don't force or control growth.
lenses.work: Expand your reach—new markets, new projects, new partnerships. Trust the momentum.
lenses.money: Expand income streams. Diversify. Trust investments to grow—don't micromanage.

name: Four of Wands

numerology.meaning: Four is celebration and foundation—stable enough to party, established enough to gather and rejoice.

upright.meaning: Celebrate the foundation you've built. The work is done—now gather and enjoy. In practice: mark the milestone. Invite your people. Celebrate what you've created together.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'homecoming party' card. You built something. Now celebrate it.
voice.pulse: Four of Wands upright is joyful foundation—stability established, celebration earned.
voice.turn: Celebrate one thing you've built—throw a party, mark the milestone, gather your people.

reversed.meaning: Either celebration is delayed (not ready yet, unstable foundation), or you're celebrating superficially (performing joy without feeling it). In practice: if unstable, strengthen foundation. If performing, find real joy.

voice.lead_in: Four of Wands reversed asks: is the foundation actually shaky, or are you going through the motions?
voice.pulse: This is the 'unstable foundation or fake celebration' card—either not ready or not genuine.
voice.turn: If unstable: do one thing that strengthens the foundation. If fake: find something to genuinely celebrate.

guidance: Celebrate the foundation. Mark milestones. Gather your people in joy.
call_to_action: Throw a celebration for something you've built. Make it real, not performative.

direct_guidance.do: Celebrate milestones. Mark achievements. Gather people to share joy in what's built.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't skip celebration because 'it's not done yet,' and don't perform joy you don't feel.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Never celebrating wins, or celebrating for show without genuine feeling.
questions: What have I built that deserves celebration?
Am I putting off joy until everything's 'perfect'?
Is this foundation solid enough to celebrate, or am I rushing the party?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Celebrate one concrete achievement—gather people, mark the moment, feel the joy.
direct_guidance.relationships: Celebrate relationship milestones—anniversaries, achievements, beautiful moments together.
direct_guidance.work: Mark project completions. Celebrate team wins. Build culture through genuine celebration.
direct_guidance.money: Celebrate financial milestones. Mark when you hit goals. Joy fuels more success.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means foundation is unstable or celebration is fake. Recalibrate: strengthen if shaky, get genuine if performing.
direct_guidance.shadow: Refusing to celebrate wins, or performing joy while feeling empty.
direct_guidance.mantra: I built this. I celebrate this. I share this joy.
direct_guidance.quick: Celebrate the foundation. Mark milestones. Gather in joy. Next 24h: Throw a celebration for one achievement.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Four of Wands shows people dancing under flower-draped staffs. Foundation built. Party thrown. Joy earned. Celebrate.

lenses.relationships: Celebrate relationship milestones—anniversaries, achievements, beautiful moments together.
lenses.work: Mark project completions. Celebrate team wins. Build culture through genuine celebration.
lenses.money: Celebrate financial milestones. Mark when you hit goals. Joy fuels more success.

name: Five of Wands

numerology.meaning: Five is conflict and competition—creative friction, clashing visions, or healthy challenge that sharpens everyone.

upright.meaning: There's friction—competing ideas, creative conflict, healthy challenge. Not malicious, just messy. In practice: engage the friction productively. Let competition sharpen you, not destroy you.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'creative chaos' card. Everyone's got ideas. No one agrees. That's fine—work it out.
voice.pulse: Five of Wands upright is productive friction—competition and conflict that sharpens rather than destroys.
voice.turn: Engage one conflict directly today. Make it about ideas, not egos. Let it sharpen you.

reversed.meaning: Either conflict is resolved (found common ground), or it's become toxic (ego battles, unproductive fighting). In practice: if resolved, move forward together. If toxic, disengage or set boundaries.

voice.lead_in: Five of Wands reversed asks: did you find common ground, or has this become an ego war?
voice.pulse: This is the 'resolution or toxicity' card—either productive friction resolved or destructive combat.
voice.turn: If resolved: commit to moving forward together. If toxic: disengage from one unproductive fight.

guidance: Engage friction productively. Let competition sharpen you. Keep it about ideas, not egos.
call_to_action: Enter one competition or conflict. Make it productive, not personal.

direct_guidance.do: Engage creative friction. Compete healthily. Let challenges sharpen your ideas.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't avoid all conflict, and don't let competition become toxic ego battles.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Turning creative disagreement into personal attacks, or avoiding healthy challenge.
questions: Is this friction sharpening ideas or stroking egos?
Am I competing to grow or competing to dominate?
What could I learn from this conflict if I stayed curious?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Engage one healthy debate or competition. Make it about growth, not winning.
direct_guidance.relationships: Healthy conflict can strengthen connection. Fight fair. Don't avoid hard conversations.
direct_guidance.work: Compete with colleagues healthily. Let diverse ideas clash productively.
direct_guidance.money: Competition in business is healthy. Outperform fairly. Let it sharpen your edge.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means conflict is either resolved or toxic. Recalibrate: move forward if resolved, disengage if destructive.
direct_guidance.shadow: Toxic competition, ego battles disguised as 'healthy conflict,' or avoiding all friction.
direct_guidance.mantra: I engage friction. I stay curious. I grow through challenge.
direct_guidance.quick: Engage friction productively. Compete healthily. Let challenge sharpen you. Next 24h: Enter one healthy debate.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Five of Wands shows people clashing staffs—chaotic, passionate, everyone engaged. Not war. Creative friction. Work it out.

lenses.relationships: Healthy conflict can strengthen connection. Fight fair. Don't avoid hard conversations.
lenses.work: Compete with colleagues healthily. Let diverse ideas clash productively.
lenses.money: Competition in business is healthy. Outperform fairly. Let it sharpen your edge.

name: Six of Wands

numerology.meaning: Six is victory and public recognition—you've won and people are celebrating you for it.

upright.meaning: You've won and people are acknowledging it. This is earned recognition. In practice: accept the praise. Own the victory. Let yourself be seen succeeding.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'victory lap' card. You won. People see it. Let them celebrate you.
voice.pulse: Six of Wands upright is earned victory—public recognition for work well done.
voice.turn: Share one win publicly today. Accept praise without deflecting. You earned this.

reversed.meaning: Either success is hollow (recognition without substance), or you're refusing recognition (downplaying wins, hiding success). In practice: if hollow, get real about your work. If hiding, let yourself be seen.

voice.lead_in: Six of Wands reversed asks: is this empty recognition, or are you refusing to own your success?
voice.pulse: This is the 'hollow victory or hidden success' card—either unearned praise or refusing deserved recognition.
voice.turn: If hollow: do real work worth celebrating. If hiding: share one genuine win today.

guidance: Accept recognition. Own victories. Let yourself be seen succeeding.
call_to_action: Share one win publicly. Accept praise. Let people celebrate you.

direct_guidance.do: Accept recognition gracefully. Own victories. Let yourself be seen succeeding.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't downplay genuine success, and don't accept praise for work you didn't do.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Imposter syndrome that refuses recognition, or taking credit for others' work.
questions: What success am I downplaying that I should own?
Am I refusing recognition out of humility or insecurity?
Did I actually earn this recognition, or am I performing success?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Share one genuine win. Accept praise without deflecting. Own what you've achieved.
direct_guidance.relationships: Celebrate your partner publicly. Let people see your love and success together.
direct_guidance.work: Accept recognition for work well done. Share wins. Let your success be visible.
direct_guidance.money: Celebrate financial wins. Let success be seen. Abundance shared inspires more abundance.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means recognition is hollow or you're hiding success. Recalibrate: earn it if empty, own it if hiding.
direct_guidance.shadow: False humility hiding insecurity, or taking credit for work you didn't do.
direct_guidance.mantra: I won. I earned this. I accept recognition.
direct_guidance.quick: Accept recognition. Own victories. Let success be seen. Next 24h: Share one win, accept praise.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Six of Wands rides through crowds holding a wreath-topped staff. Victory. Recognition. Earned. Take the praise.

lenses.relationships: Celebrate your partner publicly. Let people see your love and success together.
lenses.work: Accept recognition for work well done. Share wins. Let your success be visible.
lenses.money: Celebrate financial wins. Let success be seen. Abundance shared inspires more abundance.

name: Seven of Wands

numerology.meaning: Seven is defense and standing ground—holding your position against opposition, protecting what you've built.

upright.meaning: You're under pressure but holding your ground. People are challenging you—stand firm. In practice: defend your position. Don't back down from what you know is right.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'hold the line' card. You're being challenged. Stand your ground.
voice.pulse: Seven of Wands upright is courageous defense—holding position despite opposition.
voice.turn: Defend one position or boundary today. Don't apologize for standing firm.

reversed.meaning: Either you're giving up too easily (not defending what matters), or you're fighting battles not worth defending. In practice: if giving up, stand firm. If wrong battle, let it go.

voice.lead_in: Seven of Wands reversed asks: are you giving up when you should fight, or fighting when you should walk away?
voice.pulse: This is the 'giving up or wrong battle' card—either surrendering too soon or defending the indefensible.
voice.turn: If giving up: defend one thing that matters today. If wrong battle: walk away from one fight.

guidance: Stand your ground on what matters. Defend your position with courage.
call_to_action: Hold firm on one boundary or belief. Don't back down from what's right.

direct_guidance.do: Defend what matters. Stand firm under pressure. Hold your ground courageously.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't give up too easily, and don't waste energy defending things that don't matter.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Backing down from important stands, or stubbornly defending the indefensible.
questions: What am I defending—is it worth fighting for?
Am I standing firm or just being stubborn?
Where am I giving up when I should hold ground?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Defend one position or boundary under pressure. Hold firm without apology.
direct_guidance.relationships: Hold boundaries even when challenged. Don't give up on what matters in relationships.
direct_guidance.work: Defend your work and ideas. Stand firm against unfair criticism or opposition.
direct_guidance.money: Protect financial boundaries. Don't let pressure make you compromise your values.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either giving up or fighting wrong battles. Recalibrate: stand firm if giving up, let go if wrong fight.
direct_guidance.shadow: Backing down from important stands, or stubbornly defending ego instead of truth.
direct_guidance.mantra: I stand my ground. I defend what matters.
direct_guidance.quick: Stand your ground. Defend what matters. Hold position courageously. Next 24h: Defend one boundary firmly.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Seven of Wands stands on high ground, fending off six challengers. Hold your position. You earned this ground. Don't give it up.

lenses.relationships: Hold boundaries even when challenged. Don't give up on what matters in relationships.
lenses.work: Defend your work and ideas. Stand firm against unfair criticism or opposition.
lenses.money: Protect financial boundaries. Don't let pressure make you compromise your values.

name: Eight of Wands

numerology.meaning: Eight is speed and momentum—everything happening at once, rapid movement, swift action.

upright.meaning: Things are moving fast—messages flying, opportunities coming, everything accelerating. In practice: move quickly. Keep pace. Strike while momentum is hot.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'move fast' card. Things are accelerating. Keep pace. Act now.
voice.pulse: Eight of Wands upright is rapid momentum—speed that demands quick action and bold moves.
voice.turn: Respond to one opportunity immediately. Move fast while momentum is building.

reversed.meaning: Either momentum is stalling (delays, obstacles slowing progress), or things are moving too fast (overwhelmed by speed). In practice: if stalling, push harder. If overwhelmed, slow down deliberately.

voice.lead_in: Eight of Wands reversed asks: is momentum stalling, or are you moving too fast to keep up?
voice.pulse: This is the 'stalled speed or chaos' card—either can't build momentum or can't control it.
voice.turn: If stalled: add urgency to one project. If overwhelmed: deliberately slow one thing down.

guidance: Move quickly. Keep pace with momentum. Act while the window is open.
call_to_action: Respond to one opportunity immediately. Speed matters here.

direct_guidance.do: Move quickly when momentum builds. Act fast on opportunities. Keep pace with acceleration.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't let momentum stall through hesitation, and don't move so fast you lose control.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Hesitation killing momentum, or speed creating chaos without direction.
questions: What opportunity requires immediate action?
Am I moving fast enough to capitalize on this momentum?
Am I moving with speed and direction, or just speed and chaos?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Act on one time-sensitive opportunity. Move fast. Don't overthink—just go.
direct_guidance.relationships: When connection accelerates, move with it. Don't hesitate—respond quickly.
direct_guidance.work: Move fast on opportunities. When momentum builds, capitalize immediately.
direct_guidance.money: Act quickly on time-sensitive financial opportunities. Speed creates competitive advantage.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means momentum is either stalling or overwhelming. Recalibrate: push if stalled, slow deliberately if chaotic.
direct_guidance.shadow: Hesitation killing opportunities, or chaos from moving too fast without direction.
direct_guidance.mantra: I move fast. I keep pace. I act now.
direct_guidance.quick: Move quickly. Keep pace with momentum. Act on opportunities. Next 24h: Respond immediately to one time-sensitive thing.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Eight of Wands shows eight staffs flying through air. Swift. Direct. Unstoppable momentum. Move fast. Strike now.

lenses.relationships: When connection accelerates, move with it. Don't hesitate—respond quickly.
lenses.work: Move fast on opportunities. When momentum builds, capitalize immediately.
lenses.money: Act quickly on time-sensitive financial opportunities. Speed creates competitive advantage.

name: Nine of Wands

numerology.meaning: Nine is resilience and persistence—battle-worn but still standing, one more push to the finish.

upright.meaning: You're exhausted but almost there. One more push. In practice: rest if you can, but keep going. You're too close to quit now.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'one more round' card. You're tired. You're close. Don't quit now.
voice.pulse: Nine of Wands upright is exhausted resilience—keeping going when you want to quit.
voice.turn: Acknowledge you're tired. Then do one more thing toward the goal anyway.

reversed.meaning: Either you've pushed past your limit (burnout approaching), or you're giving up right before the finish. In practice: if burned out, rest now. If giving up, push one more time.

voice.lead_in: Nine of Wands reversed asks: are you actually burned out, or are you quitting too soon?
voice.pulse: This is the 'burnout or premature quit' card—either pushed too far or giving up before the end.
voice.turn: If burned out: stop everything for 24 hours. If quitting: do one final push before walking away.

guidance: Acknowledge exhaustion. Then push one more time. You're too close to quit.
call_to_action: Do one more thing toward the goal despite being tired. Don't quit now.

direct_guidance.do: Persist despite exhaustion. Push one more time. Rest after you finish, not before.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't quit right before the finish, and don't push into actual burnout.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Giving up just before success, or ignoring burnout signals.
questions: Am I actually burned out, or am I just tired and close to finishing?
What would happen if I pushed one more time?
Is this exhaustion telling me to rest or to persist?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Do one more push toward your goal despite being tired. Then assess if you need rest.
direct_guidance.relationships: Keep showing up even when connection feels hard. You're building something real.
direct_guidance.work: Persist through the difficult final stretch. Don't quit right before breakthrough.
direct_guidance.money: Keep working the financial plan even when results feel slow. Persistence pays.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either burned out or quitting too soon. Recalibrate: rest if burned out, push if quitting.
direct_guidance.shadow: Quitting right before success, or pushing into dangerous burnout.
direct_guidance.mantra: I'm tired. I'm close. I push one more time.
direct_guidance.quick: Persist despite exhaustion. Push one more time. Finish before resting. Next 24h: Do one more thing despite being tired.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Nine of Wands stands wounded but ready, eight staffs behind, one in hand. Battle-worn. Still standing. One more push.

lenses.relationships: Keep showing up even when connection feels hard. You're building something real.
lenses.work: Persist through the difficult final stretch. Don't quit right before breakthrough.
lenses.money: Keep working the financial plan even when results feel slow. Persistence pays.

name: Ten of Wands

numerology.meaning: Ten is burden and completion—carrying too much, but almost at the destination.

upright.meaning: You're carrying too much and it's heavy. But you're close to the destination. In practice: acknowledge the burden. Delegate what you can. Carry the rest home.

voice.lead_in: This is the 'carrying too much' card. You're overloaded. But you're almost there.
voice.pulse: Ten of Wands upright is honorable burden—carrying more than you should, but doing it anyway.
voice.turn: Delegate one burden today. Or drop one thing entirely. Lighten the load.

reversed.meaning: Either you're releasing burdens (delegating, letting go), or you're refusing responsibility (dropping everything). In practice: if releasing, good—keep going. If avoiding, pick up what's actually yours.

voice.lead_in: Ten of Wands reversed asks: are you wisely letting go, or avoiding all responsibility?
voice.pulse: This is the 'release or avoidance' card—either healthy delegation or refusing to carry your weight.
voice.turn: If releasing: delegate one more thing. If avoiding: pick up one responsibility you've dropped.

guidance: Acknowledge the burden. Delegate what you can. Carry the rest to completion.
call_to_action: Delegate one thing or drop one burden entirely. Lighten your load.

direct_guidance.do: Acknowledge when you're carrying too much. Delegate. Drop what's not essential.
direct_guidance.dont: Don't martyr yourself by carrying everything, and don't drop all responsibility.
direct_guidance.watch_for: Martyrdom disguised as 'being strong,' or avoiding all burdens out of laziness.
questions: What am I carrying that someone else could handle?
Am I being strong or being stubborn about asking for help?
What burden could I drop completely without guilt?
direct_guidance.next_24h: Delegate one task or drop one commitment. Literally lighten your load today.
direct_guidance.relationships: Share burdens in partnership. Don't carry relationship work alone.
direct_guidance.work: Delegate or say no. You don't have to do everything to be valuable.
direct_guidance.money: Don't take on all financial burdens alone. Share responsibility. Ask for help.
direct_guidance.reversed_shift: Reversed means you're either releasing burdens or avoiding responsibility. Recalibrate: keep releasing if healthy, pick up what's yours if avoiding.
direct_guidance.shadow: Martyrdom through carrying everything, or refusing to carry your fair share.
direct_guidance.mantra: I delegate. I release. I carry only what's mine.
direct_guidance.quick: Acknowledge the burden. Delegate what you can. Lighten the load. Next 24h: Delegate one task or drop one commitment.
direct_guidance.poetic_hint: Ten of Wands carries ten heavy staffs toward home. Overloaded. Almost there. Put some down. Ask for help.
